news.title: Quorum-threshold reduction proposal
news.content: According to the [proposal](https://www.tally.xyz/gov/arbitrum/proposal/94423886836435773843507976898262621297544156552971145658873213763398017341229?govId=eip155:42161:0xf07DeD9dC292157749B6Fd268E37DF6EA38395B9), this Constitutional AIP would lower the on-chain quorum from 5% to 4.5% of votable ARB, aiming to reduce gridlock in future governance cycles.

news.title: Sky Protocol Proposes Gateway Upgrade for USDS on Arbitrum
news.content: Sky Protocol has [submitted](https://www.tally.xyz/gov/arbitrum/proposal/71020107401388505040510993373598301285550678565865201408741893567942851985019?govId=eip155:42161:0xf07DeD9dC292157749B6Fd268E37DF6EA38395B9) a Constitutional proposal to the Arbitrum DAO, requesting the registration of Sky Custom Gateway contracts into the official Arbitrum Router. This change would enable USDS and sUSDS tokens to be bridged using the Arbitrum Bridge UI, enhancing user experience and eliminating current restrictions.

news.title: Arbitrum DAO Opens Vote for Audit Committee Technical Expert
news.content: At the moment of writing, the Arbitrum DAO is [holding elections](https://snapshot.box/#/s:arbitrumfoundation.eth/proposal/0x131574819442cb6da293795ee9faeec4754a5af664b535b654b3d9d3d53f47e1) to fill a Technical Expert seat on its Audit Committee—an essential role in advancing the recently approved Arbitrum Audit Program. Two finalists, Gustavo Grieco and Andrei Andonov, have been shortlisted from a pool of 68 candidates.

news.title: Extend AGV Council Term and Align Future Elections with Operational Cadence
news.content: The Arbitrum DAO has [a proposal](https://snapshot.box/#/s:arbitrumfoundation.eth/proposal/0xd7529f75df21183d0eb9bce0cc828d56e9a100f449857c16177d98db6497cc16) under voting to extend the current AGV Council’s term through December 31, 2025, aligning future elections with the calendar year. The goal: ensure operational stability during AGV’s first full year of execution.

news.title: Lampros DAO Launches Arbitrum Orbit Chains Dune Dashboard
news.content: Lampros DAO [introduced](https://forum.arbitrum.foundation/t/arbitrum-orbit-chains-dune-dashboard-by-lampros-dao/29396?utm_source=chatgpt.com) a Dune Analytics dashboard to monitor on-chain activity across Arbitrum Orbit chains, including Apechain, Corn, and Degen. The dashboard provides insights into transaction performance, gas metrics, and contract activity.

news.title: Hive Intelligence goes live on Arbitrum
news.content: AI-ready data feeds arrive: Hive’s API enables builders to query real-time, LLM-formatted blockchain data across 60+ networks — [now including Arbitrum](https://x.com/Hive_Intel/status/1937495643892703311?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1937495643892703311%7Ctwgr%5E1ee5c28142923c7695cf102b8671f0db5f9a55e0%7Ctwcon%5Es1_&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.crypto-news-flash.com%2Fhive-intelligence-unlocks-smarter-blockchain-use-on-arbitrum%2F%3Futm_source%3Dchatgpt.com)

news.title: ApeChain data goes live on Dune
news.content: Dune [added](https://dune.com/chains/ape) full real-time data support for ApeChain, the L3 built by ApeCoin DAO on Arbitrum Orbit. Developers can now query on-chain activity, create dashboards, and monitor ecosystem growth without running their indexers.

news.title: ZKsync Gateway is live
news.content: ZKsync [launches](https://x.com/zksync/status/1932480613342458064) Gateway, a middleware that aggregates proofs from every Elastic-Chain into one on-chain verification, and will add native cross-chain messaging in v29.

news.title: ZKsync Launches Airbender: The Fastest Open-Source RISC-V zkVM
news.content: ZKsync has [unveiled](https://zksync.mirror.xyz/ZgRmbYA_EE3wfGcXWv81m-xcED-ppNKkRzkleS6YZRc) Airbender, a groundbreaking open-source zkVM built on the RISC-V architecture that is redefining performance benchmarks in zero-knowledge proving. Touted as the fastest system of its kind, Airbender is capable of proving average Ethereum blocks in under 35 seconds using just a single GPU—an achievement that drastically reduces hardware requirements and unlocks the possibility of real-time proving on consumer-grade machines.

news.title: ZKsync Unveils “ZKnomics” Tokenomics Vision to Power Next-Gen Protocol Economy
news.content: ZKsync [has introduced](https://forum.zknation.io/t/zknomics-roadmap-vision/712) ZKnomics, a long-term tokenomics framework designed to align the ZK token with the protocol’s evolving infrastructure and, of course, all Elastic chains. As core systems like Gateway, EVM Equivalence, and Prividium come online, ZKnomics proposes a usage-based revenue model where protocol fees are directed toward staking rewards and supply management via token burns.

news.title: GenLayer launched “Asimov”
news.content: GenLayer [has launched](https://x.com/GenLayer/status/1935668887577632966) its first incentivized testnet, Asimov, now live on the Elastic Network. This marks the debut of AI-driven “Intelligent Contracts” and invites both validators and developers to begin building ahead of the GenLayer L3 mainnet. According to GenLayer’s press release, Asimov is the first Elastic-Chain testnet and represents a key milestone in their roadmap toward an AI-powered GenLayer Chain built on zkSync technology.

news.title: DAMA 2 litepaper release
news.content: Deutsche Bank, Axelar Network, and Memento Blockchain (The ZK Chain based on the ZKSync Stack) [published](https://www.db.com/news/detail/20250618-dama-2-litepaper-institutional-blueprint-for-asset-tokenisation-and-servicing-on-ethereum-layer-2?utm_source=chatgpt.com) a litepaper describing the Digital Asset Management Access (DAMA) 2 project in detail. The paper provides a blueprint for a next-generation tokenisation platform, built on public blockchains with regulatory alignment and privacy as core design principles.

news.title: State of ZKsync Q1 2025 by Messari
news.content: In its Q1 2025 report, Messari [highlights](https://messari.io/report/state-of-zksync-q1-2025) explosive growth across ZKsync’s Elastic Network, with daily transactions up 276%, driven by the addition of new chains such as Abstract, WonderFi, and Lens. While ZK’s token price dropped 64%, the network posted strong fundamentals, emerging as the second-largest blockchain for tokenized RWAs with over $2B in assets.

news.title: Upgrade 16 proposal posted
news.content: Interop-ready contracts, a higher 500M gas limit, and removal of a permissioned role are [now live for review](https://gov.optimism.io/t/upgrade-16-proposal-interop-contracts-stage-1-and-go-1-23-support-in-cannon/10037?utm_source=chatgpt.com) on the governance forum. Native Superchain-to-Superchain messaging will be switched on in a follow-up upgrade later this summer.

news.title: Bug-bounty pool now covers future upgrades
news.content: OP Labs [has extended its $2 million program](https://blog.oplabs.co/optimism-extends-2-million-bug-bounty-program-to-protocol-upgrades-ahead-of-superchain-interop/?utm_source=chatgpt.com), allowing white-hats to audit Upgrade 16 (and all subsequent releases) before the code reaches the main-net, adding an extra safety layer ahead of the interop launch.

news.title: SuperStacks Incentive Program Running Until June 30
news.content: Optimism [has launched SuperStacks](https://www.superchain.eco/programs/superstacks), a pilot points program designed to reward users for providing liquidity to designated pools that utilize interoperable assets, such as USDT0, across various OP Chains. Participants earn Experience Points (XP) based on the amount and duration of liquidity provided.

news.title: Kraken Ink Network to Launch INK Token with Airdrop
news.content: Kraken Ink Network, built on Optimism Superchain, is [set to launch](https://x.com/inkfndhq/status/1934991629552656720) its native INK token. The token, with a fixed supply of 1 billion, will be distributed via a community airdrop on Aave.

news.title: Sky Protocol Launches $SKY on Optimism, Replaces MKR for DAO Governance
news.content: Sky Protocol [has officially launched](https://x.com/SkyEcosystem/status/1937236854354366517?ref_src=twsrc^tfw|twcamp^tweetembed|twterm^1937236854354366517|twgr^0ffccebe09b7fc90bfb9e91a3c02b7d45dae9894|twcon^s1_&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.crypto-news-flash.com%2Fsky-protocol-launches-sky-token-on-optimism%2F%3Futm_source%3Dchatgpt.com) its native $SKY token on Optimism, marking a significant leap in accessibility and adoption across the Superchain ecosystem.

news.title: Introduction of "Optimistic Approval" Process
news.content: As part of the Season 8 governance revamp, Optimism [will introduce](https://optimism.mirror.xyz/JR5YEsK9-bM6At6c6iC5RiNNE4XXi0sMp3ytINq0wXw) an "optimistic approval" process, where proposals automatically pass unless a stakeholder vetoes them.

news.title: Season 8 Intent Focused on Interoperability
news.content: The [primary intent](https://gov.optimism.io/t/season-8-intent/10009) of Season 8 is to improve the interoperability within the Superchain.

news.title: “Guide to Season 8” & tooling docs published
news.content: The Optimism Foundation has created documentation for Season 8 that [explains](https://gov.optimism.io/t/guide-to-season-8/10001?utm_source=chatgpt.com) delegate roles, the new Developer Advisory Board, and how to onboard under the purpose-built framework.

news.title: Agglayer v0.3 is live
news.content: [Agglayer v0.3 is now live](https://www.agglayer.dev/blogs/agglayer-v0-3-is-live), introducing a new execution-proof mode that lets chains prove their own state using ZK proofs—no architectural changes needed. This expands the existing pessimistic proof, adding a new security layer akin to 2FA for interop. Polygon PoS is set to connect by end of Q3, with Katana going live first. The upgrade lays the foundation for fast, sub-10s, chain-agnostic interoperability across diverse blockchain ecosystems.

news.title: Polygon Winds Down zkEVM to Prioritize Agglayer and Scalable Growth
news.content: Polygon Labs [has announced](https://forum.polygon.technology/t/sunsetting-polygon-zkevm-mainnet-beta-in-2026/21020) it will sunset Polygon zkEVM Mainnet Beta in 2026. The decision frees up resources for core priorities: Polygon PoS and Agglayer. Support for zkEVM will wind down over 12 months, with forced exits enabled permanently and no new EIP upgrades planned. Transition grants will assist teams migrating to chains like Polygon PoS, and no user funds will be lost during the wind-down.

news.title: Polygon Doubles Down on Agglayer as Sandeep Nailwal Becomes Foundation CEO
news.content: Polygon co-founder Sandeep Nailwal [has officially](https://x.com/sandeepnailwal/status/1932748558786310228) takes over as CEO of the Polygon Foundation, with Agglayer as the strategic focus.

news.title: Katana Launches High-Yield Blockchain for Institutional DeFi, Backed by Polygon
news.content: The Katana Foundation [has launched](https://www.coindesk.com/tech/2025/05/28/polygon-gsr-release-katana-network-tackle-defi-fragmentation) the mainnet of its new DeFi-optimized blockchain. Katana is the first Agglayer CDK chain to adopt the CDK OP Stack. Connected to the Agglayer’s Bridge, Katana enables cross-chain DeFi yield and aims to unify fragmented liquidity into a sustainable yield engine.

news.title: EigenCloud has been launched to Bring Blockchain-Grade Trust to Any App
news.content: Eigen Labs [has launched](https://blog.eigencloud.xyz/introducing-eigencloud/) the alpha version of EigenCloud, integrating EigenDA, EigenCompute, and EigenVerify. As usage grows, EigenCloud will generate protocol fees that flow back to restakers, turning Ethereum into a programmable trust layer. With $12B+ already restaked and over 200 AVSs secured, EigenLayer is now expanding from infrastructure to application-level trust at scale.

news.title: Redistribution is Live on Testnet
news.content: EigenLayer [activated](https://blog.eigencloud.xyz/redistribution-is-live-on-testnet/) its new “Redistribution” slashing mode on testnet; mainnet rollout expected late June → July 2025. AVSs can now redirect slashed funds (e.g. to reimburse users, reward reliable operators, or power lending / insurance logic) instead of burning them.

news.title: EigenLayer Hits $817M Staked as AI Agents and Verifiable Apps Advance
news.content: June update highlights: AI agent OB-1, $817M TVL, Eigen Bootcamp cohort 2, and enhanced app primitives. [[source](https://x.com/eigenlayer/status/1934113722366120025)]

news.title: VIBEscore: Judged by AI. Verifiable by All
news.content: Eigen Labs [has launched](https://blog.eigencloud.xyz/vibescore/) VIBEscore, a gamified app that scores crypto Twitter posts using verifiable AI, built on EigenLayer.

news.title: Nethermind’s April Feature: “Surge — A Based Rollup for Ethereum’s Future”
news.content: Nethermind published a new blog post on Surge - a [new rollup template](https://www.nethermind.io/blog/surge-a-based-rollup-template-designed-for-ethereums-future?utm_source=chatgpt.com) built on the Taiko stack with Stage 2 security and no admin keys.

news.title: Nethermind Reveals Smarter Restaking Strategy for Symbiotic Vaults
news.content: Nethermind’s [latest research](https://www.nethermind.io/blog/optimizing-restaking-yields-a-hybrid-quantitative-qualitative-model) proposes a hybrid model for optimizing restaking yields in Symbiotic.

news.title: Nethermind Secures Pimlico’s Cross-Chain Account Abstraction Infrastructure
news.content: Pimlico [partnered](https://www.nethermind.io/blog/securing-pimlicos-account-abstraction-infrastructure?utm_source=chatgpt.com) with Nethermind Security to audit its ERC-4337 cross-chain infrastructure.
